Sławomir Konrad Tadeja PhD Student, VR Enthusiast, Programmer

About Me Projects

My Expertise

PhD Student in VR-tech with emphasis on Visual Analytics

Education

Currently, I'm a third year PhD student in the Department of Engineering, University of Cambridge, UK.

I hold Magister (MSc) and Licencjat (BSc) Degrees in Computer Science from the Faculty of Physics, Astronomy and Applied Computer Science, Jagiellonian University in Krakow, Poland.

Code

In my day-to-day work I constantly use C# and Python. The latter I'm also teaching to the first year engineering undergraduets at the University of Cambridge. In my previous work I've also used Python for data pre-processing visualisation (CERN/ESA/Jagiellonian) and C++ (ESA/ESA/Jagiellonian). I'm also teaching C language to the undergraduates at the Computer Laboratory at Cambridge.

Tools

In my work and privately, I work on all three main OS'es i.e. iOS, Windows and on various Linux flavours, including amongst others, Ubuntu, Red Hat, Scientific Linux.
